verses.verse: I <S%H559>said<s%> in mine <S%H3820>heart<s%>, Go to <S%H3212>now<s%>, I will <S%H5254>prove<s%> thee with <S%H8057>mirth<s%>, therefore <S%H7200>enjoy<s%> <S%H2896>pleasure<s%>: and, behold, this also is <S%H1892>vanity<s%>.
I <S%H559>said<s%> of <S%H7814>laughter<s%>, It is <S%H1984>mad<s%>: and of <S%H8057>mirth<s%>, <S%H2090>What<s%> <S%H6213>doeth<s%> it?

I <S%H8446>sought<s%> in mine <S%H3820>heart<s%> to <S%H4900>give<s%> <S%H1320>myself<s%> unto <S%H3196>wine<s%>, yet <S%H5090>acquainting<s%> mine <S%H3820>heart<s%> with <S%H2451>wisdom<s%>; and to lay <S%H270>hold<s%> on <S%H5531>folly<s%>, till I might <S%H7200>see<s%> what was that <S%H2896>good<s%> for the <S%H1121>sons<s%> of <S%H120>men<s%>, which they should <S%H6213>do<s%> under the <S%H8064>heaven<s%> <S%H4557>all<s%> the <S%H3117>days<s%> of their <S%H2416>life<s%>.
I made me <S%H1431>great<s%> <S%H4639>works<s%>; I <S%H1129>builded<s%> me <S%H1004>houses<s%>; I <S%H5193>planted<s%> me <S%H3754>vineyards<s%>:
I <S%H6213>made<s%> me <S%H1593>gardens<s%> and <S%H6508>orchards<s%>, and I <S%H5193>planted<s%> <S%H6086>trees<s%> in them of all kind of <S%H6529>fruits<s%>:
I <S%H6213>made<s%> me <S%H1295>pools<s%> of <S%H4325>water<s%>, to <S%H8248>water<s%> therewith the <S%H3293>wood<s%> that bringeth <S%H6779>forth<s%> <S%H6086>trees<s%>:

I <S%H7069>got<s%> me <S%H5650>servants<s%> and <S%H8198>maidens<s%>, and had servants <S%H1121>born<s%> in my <S%H1004>house<s%>; also I had <S%H7235>great<s%> <S%H4735>possessions<s%> of <S%H1241>great<s%> and small <S%H6629>cattle<s%> above all that were in <S%H3389>Jerusalem<s%> <S%H6440>before<s%> me:

I <S%H3664>gathered<s%> me also <S%H3701>silver<s%> and <S%H2091>gold<s%>, and the peculiar <S%H5459>treasure<s%> of <S%H4428>kings<s%> and of the <S%H4082>provinces<s%>: I <S%H6213>gat<s%> me men <S%H7891>singers<s%> and women <S%H7891>singers<s%>, and the <S%H8588>delights<s%> of the <S%H1121>sons<s%> of <S%H120>men<s%>, as musical <S%H7705%H7705>instruments<s%>, and that of all sorts.
So I was <S%H1431>great<s%>, and <S%H3254>increased<s%> more than all that were <S%H6440>before<s%> me in <S%H3389>Jerusalem<s%>: also my <S%H2451>wisdom<s%> <S%H5975>remained<s%> with me.

And whatsoever mine <S%H5869>eyes<s%> <S%H7592>desired<s%> I <S%H680>kept<s%> not from them, I <S%H4513>withheld<s%> not my <S%H3820>heart<s%> from any <S%H8057>joy<s%>; for my <S%H3820>heart<s%> <S%H8056>rejoiced<s%> in all my <S%H5999>labour<s%>: and this was my <S%H2506>portion<s%> of all my <S%H5999>labour<s%>.

Then I <S%H6437>looked<s%> on all the <S%H4639>works<s%> that my <S%H3027>hands<s%> had <S%H6213>wrought<s%>, and on the <S%H5999>labour<s%> that I had <S%H5998>laboured<s%> to <S%H6213>do<s%>: and, behold, all was <S%H1892>vanity<s%> and <S%H7469>vexation<s%> of <S%H7307>spirit<s%>, and there was no <S%H3504>profit<s%> under the <S%H8121>sun<s%>.

¶ And I <S%H6437>turned<s%> myself to <S%H7200>behold<s%> <S%H2451>wisdom<s%>, and <S%H1947>madness<s%>, and <S%H5531>folly<s%>: for what can the <S%H120>man<s%> do that <S%H935>cometh<s%> <S%H310>after<s%> the <S%H4428>king<s%>? even that which hath been <S%H3528>already<s%> <S%H6213>done<s%>.
Then I <S%H7200>saw<s%> <S%H3426>that<s%> <S%H2451>wisdom<s%> <S%H3504>excelleth<s%> <S%H5531>folly<s%>, as far as <S%H216>light<s%> <S%H3504>excelleth<s%> <S%H2822>darkness<s%>.

The wise <S%H2450>man's<s%> <S%H5869>eyes<s%> are in his <S%H7218>head<s%>; but the <S%H3684>fool<s%> <S%H1980>walketh<s%> in <S%H2822>darkness<s%>: and I myself <S%H3045>perceived<s%> also that <S%H259>one<s%> <S%H4745>event<s%> <S%H7136>happeneth<s%> to them all.

<S%H227>Then<s%> <S%H559>said<s%> I in my <S%H3820>heart<s%>, As it <S%H4745>happeneth<s%> to the <S%H3684>fool<s%>, so it <S%H7136>happeneth<s%> even to <S%H1571>me<s%>; and why was I then <S%H3148>more<s%> <S%H2449>wise<s%>? Then I <S%H1696>said<s%> in my <S%H3820>heart<s%>, that this also is <S%H1892>vanity<s%>.

For there is no <S%H2146>remembrance<s%> of the <S%H2450>wise<s%> more <S%H5973>than<s%> of the <S%H3684>fool<s%> for <S%H5769>ever<s%>; seeing that which <S%H3528>now<s%> is in the <S%H3117>days<s%> to <S%H935>come<s%> shall all be <S%H7911>forgotten<s%>. And how <S%H4191>dieth<s%> the <S%H2450>wise<s%> man? as the <S%H3684>fool<s%>.

Therefore I <S%H8130>hated<s%> <S%H2416>life<s%>; because the <S%H4639>work<s%> that is <S%H6213>wrought<s%> under the <S%H8121>sun<s%> is <S%H7451>grievous<s%> unto me: for all is <S%H1892>vanity<s%> and <S%H7469>vexation<s%> of <S%H7307>spirit<s%>.

¶ Yea, I <S%H8130>hated<s%> all my <S%H5999>labour<s%> which I had <S%H6001>taken<s%> under the <S%H8121>sun<s%>: because I should <S%H3240>leave<s%> it unto the <S%H120>man<s%> that shall be <S%H310>after<s%> me.

And who <S%H3045>knoweth<s%> whether he shall be a <S%H2450>wise<s%> man or a <S%H5530>fool<s%>? yet shall he have <S%H7980>rule<s%> over all my <S%H5999>labour<s%> wherein I have <S%H5998>laboured<s%>, and wherein I have shewed myself <S%H2449>wise<s%> under the <S%H8121>sun<s%>. This is also <S%H1892>vanity<s%>.
Therefore I went <S%H5437>about<s%> to <S%H2976>cause<s%> my <S%H3820>heart<s%> to <S%H2976>despair<s%> of all the <S%H5999>labour<s%> which I <S%H5998>took<s%> under the <S%H8121>sun<s%>.

For there <S%H3426>is<s%> a <S%H120>man<s%> whose <S%H5999>labour<s%> is in <S%H2451>wisdom<s%>, and in <S%H1847>knowledge<s%>, and in <S%H3788>equity<s%>; yet to a <S%H120>man<s%> that hath not <S%H5998>laboured<s%> therein shall he <S%H5414>leave<s%> it for his <S%H2506>portion<s%>. This also is <S%H1892>vanity<s%> and a <S%H7227>great<s%> <S%H7451>evil<s%>.

For what <S%H1933>hath<s%> <S%H120>man<s%> of all his <S%H5999>labour<s%>, and of the <S%H7475>vexation<s%> of his <S%H3820>heart<s%>, <S%H1931>wherein<s%> he hath <S%H6001>laboured<s%> under the <S%H8121>sun<s%>?

For all his <S%H3117>days<s%> are <S%H4341>sorrows<s%>, and his <S%H6045>travail<s%> <S%H3708>grief<s%>; yea, his <S%H3820>heart<s%> taketh not <S%H7901>rest<s%> in the <S%H3915>night<s%>. This is also <S%H1892>vanity<s%>.

¶ There is nothing <S%H2896>better<s%> for a <S%H120>man<s%>, than that he should <S%H398>eat<s%> and <S%H8354>drink<s%>, and that he should make his <S%H5315>soul<s%> <S%H7200>enjoy<s%> <S%H2896>good<s%> in his <S%H5999>labour<s%>. <S%H2090>This<s%> also I <S%H7200>saw<s%>, that it was from the <S%H3027>hand<s%> of <S%H430>God<s%>.
For who can <S%H398>eat<s%>, or who else can <S%H2363>hasten<s%> hereunto, <S%H2351>more<s%> than I?

For God <S%H5414>giveth<s%> to a <S%H120>man<s%> that is <S%H2896>good<s%> in his <S%H6440>sight<s%> <S%H2451>wisdom<s%>, and <S%H1847>knowledge<s%>, and <S%H8057>joy<s%>: but to the <S%H2398>sinner<s%> he <S%H5414>giveth<s%> <S%H6045>travail<s%>, to <S%H622>gather<s%> and to heap <S%H3664>up<s%>, that he may <S%H5414>give<s%> to him that is <S%H2896>good<s%> <S%H6440>before<s%> <S%H430>God<s%>. This also is <S%H1892>vanity<s%> and <S%H7469>vexation<s%> of <S%H7307>spirit<s%>.
